title: Firefox sekmeyi hareket ettirince sekmenin kopyasını başka sekmede açıyor
content:
Merhabalar, Firefox'da ilginç bir sorun ile karşı karşıyayım. Tarayıcım güncel. Topbarda bulunan sekmelerden herhangi birini basılı tutup azıcık sağına bıraktığımda bıraktığım noktada Firefox tuttuğum sekmenin aynısını açıyor. Özellik mi bug mu anlamadım ama hiçbir yerde bulamadım böyle bir şey. Fare değişmeyi denedin acaba çift click mi basıyor diye (ki 1 senelik fare, böyle durum yok) ama yok...

Yüklediğim resimde mavi hareketi yapınca mavi hareketin ucunda yeni bir sekme açılıyor otomatik ve bu sekme sürüklemeye başladığım sekmenin aynısı. Teşekkür ediyorum.

title: unable to import/migrate bookmarks from chrome to firefox.
content: I tried using firefox's 'import from browser', and also the import from html bookmarks file. Neither have worked. When I uninstall firefox, it leaves folders which I then deleted. When I reinstalled firefox, again there were two user profile files, and again, when I tried to import my bookmarks from chrome, both options failed again. It's a shame that firefox was such a nice browser, but from my search, I see that lots of other people are having this problem, so I suppose it's just that the browser code has gotten so complicated that perhaps no one really knows why it's stopped working? (kind of like windows, where stuff just stops working after a while; but at least it works when it's first installed!). Let me know what you can suggest, but I've been going through this for a while, and am about to kiss firefox goodbye forever if there's no fix for this.

title: Since 1/6/21 I have been unable to access the daily express comments. I can see the green icon but no comments
content:
I cannot access the DE comments section using Firefox. I can using other web browsers. If I scroll down there is just a blank space where the comments should be. I can see the green icon on the article page showing how many comments are on the article, but when I click on that it simply jumps to the blank section again. I have deleted cookies etc. I also noticed that the tabs at the top the browser seem to 'stand out' more but I cannot remember if this happened on Tuesday as well. 

OS: Windows

OS Version: Windows 10 Browser: Firefox 88.0 Screen Resolution: 1366x728 Colour Depth: 24 bit Has Flash: No Has JS: Yes Has Cookies: No Adblocker: ublock

I have also written to the DE, but as I am able to access commenst using Microsoft edge for example, it would appear to be a problem within Firefox. The data that I sent to the DE, that the DE picked up when I logged the call, shows Firefox v88 as above, however as far as I am aware it is V89 as of the 1/6/21, which happens to be when the problem showed itself. This could be a coincidence as I logged the problem in the moring and Firefox tells me it ws updated at 16;50 that day. I am assuming that it is GMT.

Firefox 89.0 (20210527174632)Details Installed on: 1 June 2021, 16:50:58Status: The Update was successfully installed Firefox 88.0.1 (20210504152106)Details Installed on: 6 May 2021, 10:39:01Status: The Update was successfully installed

Any help appreciated. Thanks Geoff.

title: [Firefox 89] Unusable after Update due to Large Blank Rectangle on Top of Websites
content:
System Elementary OS 5.1 (Ubuntu 18.04) Nvidia 465 driver

Tried with Firefox from Ubuntu repos and Flathub

Problem Since the update, I have this rectangle (see picture) on all websites, even the settings. This makes Firefox unusable.

What I already tried

  1. Numbered list item Started Firefox in Troubleshoot-Mode, where everything works normal. Nice.
  2. Numbered list item I purged the Firefox install and removed all configs, addons etc. on disk (removed /usr/lib/mozilla, ~/.mozilla, /etc/firefox). Sadly, the Problem is still there.

So it works in Troubleshoot-Mode with my personalized Firefox version as well as a clean install, but never outside of Troubleshoot-Mode.

Question As a clean Firefox (see above) seems to work as intended, how do I reproduce this behavior outside of Troubleshoot-Mode? What changes between Troubleshoot-Mode and regular mode? Any advice?

title: Firefox crashed, updated and I lost ALL session data
content:
Hi guys,

do I assume correctly, that if after-crash update to 89.0 wiped clean my sessionstore-backups folder, I've lost all my 50+ tabs forever? Firefox crashed, I started it and it opened with no tabs, like a new installation. I immediately went to sessionstore-backups folder and found that Firefox wiped it, created new empty recovery.jsonlz4 and recovery.baklz4 files and no other files are there (no, there are no alternative profiles in my Firefox directory).

I tried to recover deleted files using Disk Drill, however they seem to be corrupt, because the History Scrounger is not able to decode them. Does anyone have any other ideas, or is this it and I just have to move on? It was on my work laptop, so recovering the tabs would be extremely helpful and would save me lots of time and possibly some trouble too.

Thank you, Sam

content:
Hello.

I'm using Firefox at second monitor, i want it to start every time at the bottom half of the screen, right at its borders.

The issue is that FF do remember the size of the window, but every time i reopen it (i do not store history - aka i use private mode) its moved a bit. As far as i can tell, the movement is random at the direction (but always both vertical and horizontal), and fixed at the distance.

It seems to behave that way no mater if i do fix the position of the window before closing it or not, but it doesnt move further from the borders (keeps starting at the 4 positions "around" where i want it to be).

Turning off private mode didnt fix that, what do work is making window a bit smaller, and not touching any border (by the same fixed distance), and its not acceptable solution for me ;)

Please help me lock that window in place, moving it by hand every time is really annoying.

title: Can't Restore Previous Session
content:
I lost like hundreds of tabs (again) and I can't get them back (again). But before I concede to the issue I was wondering if there was another way?

First of all, my browser was was running slow/freezing, understandably so figuring I had too many tabs open. So I used Windows 10 Task Manager to stop it. I then restarted Firefox, but the option to restore the tabs after a crash didn't show up. I was left staring at a blank page. I've done this a million times and it usually works. But this was one of the times that it didn't.

I did the usual step. I replaced the current session file with the backup I thought I wanted. But that didn't work. I then did some digging around and stumbled upon this tool: Scrounger for Firefox. I tried using this tool the last time this happened, but every time I try to use it it crashes.

After some searching on Google I came to the conclusion that the file was too large to handle. I then tried running this script , but all it seemed to do was backup the restore session file and more than doubled it's size.

My questions are why won't the Scrounger tool work for me and is there another way I can get my tabs back?

Thank you for any help!

But now that add on, even though Firefox says its downloaded, does not appear on the right click drop down menu and no where to be found....Appreciate a tech savy response. KEN B
creator: bkent1

title: Problems with new update
content:
April 21, 2021 Mozilla updated my Firefox to 88 and I had no problems with that update. Today I have lost hours trying to get my tabs changed so I my eyes are not strained by the glare and and appearance of the frequently used site tiles. Glare sets off my migraines. One volunteer "luckett67" suggested a temporary fix to someone else that helps so I hope it continues to work. Why am I having these issues:

1. Tabs I want open above the address bar sometimes disappear.

2. DuckDuckGo jumps from the inquiry rectangle to the https:// line on the top, which is not what I am used to.
creator: candy3066

title: Windows Default Theme
content: Why can I no longer use the Firefox default theme? I can select it, and it is listed as "Enabled" but the plain grey screen keeps showing not the default. Also, is there away to go back to Firefox 88.0.1 and not have it update again? I went to Add-ons & Themes and disable automatic updates but I still got the prompt informing me to restart Firefox to update. Is it just me or is Firefox really getting worse with each update?

title: tabs missing with new update
content:
My firefox installed a new update, 89, and now my tabs are missing, except that the active tab is floating down at the center bottom of the screen. i can still navigate with keyboard shortcuts, but i don't know how many i have open, what they are, and personally DO NOT like navigating with shortcuts if i don't have to.

why is it necessary to keep messing with tabs? weren't they just fine below the address bar back in the day? How is ruining the user experience worth whatever was even trying to be done here?

image is how my firefox looks right now
creator: luckytrefoil

title: FF 89 tabs are moved to the top, want them on the bottom below shortcut bar
content:
FF89 has moved tabs to the top of the window, above the address bar. I'd like them back where they were, below the shortcut bar.

I appreciate help, but also, please provide clear instructions for someone that is NOT a FF dev, don't just say "update your css". I'm unable to find userchrome.css it doesn't appear to exist in this version.

If possible, a simple, non Dev approach would be appreciated, such as Settings > Tabs > tick box "Tabs under shortcut bar".

For anyone working on FF development, this is the sort of thing that a lot of users would like to customize, so this setting should be in Settings and it should not be changed from what users had already set.

Thanks for your help.
creator: wharminda
